definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: China wins ping- pong mixed doubles.
sentences.chinese: 中國選手贏得了乒乓混合雙打。

sentences.english: She had five double faults, including back-to-back doubles in two games.
sentences.chinese: 她有五雙，包括斷層，後端到早在雙打兩場比賽。

sentences.english: Li Ying paired off with Liu Hua in a tennis doubles match.
sentences.chinese: 李英在網球雙打中與劉華搭檔。

sentences.english: Jane paired off with Alice in a table tennis doubles match.
sentences.chinese: 在乒乓球雙打比賽中簡與愛麗絲配對。

sentences.english: He will play Liang in a doubles "friendship" match in China.
sentences.chinese: 他將在中國與梁戈亮進行一場雙打“友誼”賽。

sentences.english: All the tennis players had to pair off for a round of doubles matches.
sentences.chinese: 所有的乒乓球運動員都得組對打一輪雙打。

sentences.english: Who won the National Mixed Doubles Championship?
sentences.chinese: 誰得了全國混合雙打的冠軍？

sentences.english: I again played doubles with Elena and mixed doubles with Mark.
sentences.chinese: 我再一次與愛琳娜搭檔雙打，和馬克打混雙。

sentences.english: Her doubles matches got only attention.
sentences.chinese: 她的雙打比賽的確引起了注意。

sentences.english: Recently I witnessed a men's doubles game between players with a fairly high skill level.
sentences.chinese: 最近親眼目睹了一場較高水平的男子雙打比賽。

sentences.english: Modern badminton is a game for two or four players using lightweight rackets and a shuttlecock.
sentences.chinese: 現代羽毛球運動分爲單打和雙打，羽毛球拍重量較輕。

sentences.english: Back Alley- Area between the back boundary line and the long service line for doubles.
sentences.chinese: 單打端線和雙打端線之間的長地帶。

sentences.english: Juggling four-club singles can be more difficult than four-club doubles.
sentences.chinese: 戲法四俱樂部單打可以比四會更加困難雙打。

sentences.english: Me and Jamie got to the semi-finals in the doubles too.
sentences.chinese: 傑米和我也打進了雙打半決賽。

sentences.english: Perhaps we can make a foursome with them.
sentences.chinese: 或許我們可以和他們組成雙打。

definition: Ever Victorious Army (1860-1864), Qing dynasty army equipped and trained jointly with Europeans and used esp. against the Taiping rebels
to snatch gold/to take first place in a competition
Lee Lai-Shan (1970-), former windsurfing world champion from Hong Kong
to serve the ball/to tee off
to win every trick in a card game/grand slam/fig. total success
Changquan - Northern Shaolin (北少林) - Longfist - Martial Art
